course_name: Objects in Context. An Interdisciplinary Perspective on the Ancient World

broad_task.stimulus: You have been assigned an ancient artifact from the archaeological collection to research for your first writing assignment. Before you dive into writing, what is the first step you should take to understand this object in its historical context?
tiny_learn: Material culture refers to physical objects made or used by people in the past.
Start by exploring both the object's features and historical background to connect it to its time.
Don't assume that all details visible on the object directly represent historical facts without checking context.

options.label: A
options.text: Examine the physical features of the artifact closely to note any inscriptions, wear, or marks.

options.label: B
options.text: Look up scholarly articles and historical records related to this type of object to understand its significance.

options.label: C
options.text: Sketch or photograph the object to capture its artistic details and symbolize its uses creatively.

options.label: D
options.text: Discuss your initial observations with classmates or tutors to get different perspectives on the object.

options.label: E
options.text: Plan how you will organize your research and outline key themes you want to explore for a strong argument.

options.label: F
options.text: Check the university library catalog and databases to identify primary and secondary sources about the object.

RIA.stimulus: You need to start researching an ancient coin for your paper. What is the first action you take to build your understanding?
tiny_learn: Realistic involves practical handling of objects.
Investigative focuses on researching and analyzing evidence.
Artistic values creative or expressive approaches.

options.label: A
options.text: Handle the coin carefully looking for physical details like inscriptions and mint marks.

options.label: B
options.text: Search academic databases for research on coins from the same period and location.

options.label: C
options.text: Create a detailed drawing to study its artistic craftsmanship and iconography.

RIS.stimulus: Your seminar is focusing on a funerary urn. You want to begin your project by choosing one starting method. What first step will you take?
tiny_learn: Realistic means working directly with the object.
Investigative means gathering knowledge and verifying evidence.
Social means discussing and getting feedback from others.

options.label: A
options.text: Inspect the urn’s material and craftsmanship to note any unique features.

options.label: B
options.text: Read scholarly articles about funerary customs related to urns in that culture.

options.label: C
options.text: Organize a group discussion with classmates to share initial ideas and questions.

REC.stimulus: You have to write about an ancient domestic utensil and decide how to start your research process. Which first step seems most useful?
tiny_learn: Realistic includes direct examination.
Enterprising means planning and deciding on a clear approach.
Conventional means organizing research materials systematically.

options.label: A
options.text: Examine the utensil’s form and signs of wear for clues on its use.

options.label: B
options.text: Outline your research goals to stay focused and prepare a timeline for study.

options.label: C
options.text: Create a detailed list of sources and references that you will need.

IEC.stimulus: You start an assignment on reliefs from an ancient temple. How do you begin your investigation most effectively?
tiny_learn: Investigative work seeks to gather detailed information.
Enterprising action involves strategizing research steps.
Conventional methods keep material well organized.

options.label: A
options.text: Find and read studies analyzing the symbolism and history of temple reliefs.

options.label: B
options.text: Plan the research stages and decide which reliefs to analyze in detail first.

options.label: C
options.text: Create a database to document all findings, images, and references for easy access.

ASE.stimulus: You are preparing to write a paper on statues in sacred contexts. Which first step fits your starting style?
tiny_learn: Artistic approaches emphasize creative and visual methods.
Social methods focus on discussing and collaborating.
Enterprising steps involve taking initiative and planning.

options.label: A
options.text: Create sketches or visual interpretations of the statues to explore their stylistic features.

options.label: B
options.text: Organize a meeting with your tutor and peers to exchange ideas and get feedback.

options.label: C
options.text: Develop a structured plan and outline for your paper focusing on key arguments and sources.

ASC.stimulus: You begin research on a complex archaeological assemblage. What do you do first?
tiny_learn: Artistic methods explore creative ways to understand objects.
Social approaches include cooperation and discussion.
Conventional work requires order and record keeping.

options.label: A
options.text: Draw or model the assemblage to visualize relationships between objects.

options.label: B
options.text: Set up a group study session to share insights and interpretations.

options.label: C
options.text: Make detailed notes and an inventory to keep track of object characteristics.
